page.title: 11WOOD FARM, WARBOYS - HISTORY
page.content: The farm is more than 200 years old ,and the Warboys railway line used to run through the middle of the farm.The railway that used to run through the farm was the Ramsey to Somersham line. Where one of the old bridges is standing ,Mr. Woodward has let it grow wild.They had to knock down a few of the farm buildings to make room for the railway line but they rebuilt them somewhere else in the farm including a horse-keepers house which still stands today.During the last war the farm was used for grazing and then it was ploughed up and used for potatoes and sugar-beet. Then they found it wasn't very good to grow sugar-beet and potatoes,so they started to grow arable crops like wheat and barley. The farm is owned by Mr. John Woodward who has owned it for fifteen years.
